Question 1

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A planned task in a sprint was nearly NOT completed because of an issue that appeared three (3) days prior but was NOT resolved. The team resolved it in the next daily standup meeting, but the project manager wants to prevent this type of situation in the future.

What should the project manager do?
Question 1 Answer
A.
During the retrospective, examine the issue.
B.
In the demo, address the issue.
C.
During the next iteration planning meeting, discuss the issue.
D.
Send an email to the team.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

"A retrospective is a great opportunity to talk about what went right, what went wrong, lessons learned, and what to improve for next time."

Câu này mình có thể tham khảo thêm PMI Gaps: https://www.atoha.com/blogs/kien-thuc/pmi-gaps (Hình ảnh mình có đính kèm). 

Thêm nữa, việc lựa chọn Retrospective là do mục đích của Retrospective sẽ phù hợp với việc cùng team khám phá các điểm cần cải thiện/actions plan hơn là Iteration Planning (kế hoạch cho các yêu cầu, tính năng làm trong một khoảng thời gian). Cụ thể: https://www.atoha.com/blogs/kien-thuc/agile-retrospectives-nhin-lai-va-cai-tien-hieu-qua-cong-viec-du-an

The correct answer is: During the retrospective, examine the issue.

Question 2

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A financial software company serves stock markets worldwide. An experimental quality assurance project has agile teams working in three company offices: Seattle, Tokyo, and London.

The teams work in two shifts in each location at the following times in each time zone:
Shift 1: 08:00h to 16:00h;
Shift 2: 16:00h – 0:00h.

Which collaboration method would ensure the fastest “follow-the-sun” problem resolution?
Question 2 Answer
A.
Conduct Scrum-of-Scrum meetings daily in order: 1 Tokyo Shift 2 with London Shift 1 - 2 London Shift 2 with Seattle Shift 1 - 3 Seattle Shift 2 with Tokyo Shift 1
B.
Run fishbowl windows during the overlapping shifts: London Shift 1 with Tokyo Shift 2 - Seattle Shift 1 with London Shift 2 - Tokyo Shift 1 with Seattle Shift 2
C.
Conduct Scrum-of-Scrum meetings daily in order: 1 Seattle Shift 2 with London Shift 1 - 2 London Shift 2 -Tokyo Shift 1 - 3 Tokyo Shift 2 -Seattle Shift 1
D.
Run fishbowl windows during the overlapping shifts: Tokyo Shift 2 with Seattle Shift 1 - London Shift 1 with Seattle Shift 2 - Tokyo Shift 1 with London Shift 2

Feedback

The fishbowl window solution allows teams to interact in real time, thus allowing faster coordination and handling of issues. The shifts overlap in follow-the-sun order: Tokyo 2-London 1, London 2-Seattle 1, Seattle 2-Tokyo 1


Giải thích thêm:

Fishbowl kiểu như ở mỗi văn phòng sẽ có 1 camera góc rộng, và màn hình lớn, mỗi ngày khi bắt đầu làm thì bật lên, hết ngày thì tắt đi. Việc này giúp cho ở mỗi văn phòng ở các nơi khác nhau có cảm giác à những team khác cũng đang làm việc cùng với mình, kiểu như tạo cảm giác như đang làm cùng văn phòng. Fishbowl phù hợp với nhiều team ở khác văn phòng nhau, rải rác nhiều nơi. Tuy nhiên do tính chất bật lên lúc đầu ngày làm việc và tắt đi lúc hết ngày làm việc, nên chỉ phù hợp với các team có cùng múi giờ, hoặc khác múi giờ thì phải làm việc cùng thời điểm (ví dụ team ở múi giờ GMT+0 làm việc lúc 8AM thì cùng thời điểm với team ở múi giờ GMT+8 làm việc lúc 16:00 (4PM)).

Múi giờ Seattle (USA) chậm hơn London (UK). Múi giờ London (UK) chậm hơn múi giờ Tokyo (Japan). 

Nghĩa là thời điểm ca 1 Seattle = thời điểm ca 2 ở London; ca 1 London = ca 2 Tokyo; ca 1 Tokyo = ca 2 Seattle.


The correct answer is: Run fishbowl windows during the overlapping shifts: London Shift 1 with Tokyo Shift 2 - Seattle Shift 1 with London Shift 2 - Tokyo Shift 1 with Seattle Shift 2

Question 3

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

The marketing director wants to be first-to-market, to launch a version of a smartphone shopping application for retired people, and has asked the agile team to develop it.

What should the project manager do to begin the development process?
Question 3 Answer
A.
Work with the product owners and SMEs to break the requirements down into stories.
B.
Meet with product owner, team, and SMEs to identify risks and risk responses.
C.
Ask the team to estimate the effort and build the business case accordingly.
D.
Meet with product owner, team, and SMEs to define the minimum viable product (MVP).

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

The requirement to be first to market implies use of an MVP, which will then be enhanced with feature requirements as quickly as possible after launch.
The correct answer is: Meet with product owner, team, and SMEs to define the minimum viable product (MVP).

Question 4

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A company is losing market share to competitors with new business models. The agile team is asked to restrict the number of features of a product and release a version more quickly to the market.

How will this request impact the planning?
Question 4 Answer
A.
The backlog will be prioritized to deliver basic functionality in small increments.
B.
The product vision will be updated to reflect a user-driven release roadmap.
C.
The sprint backlog will be reprioritized to work on the smallest and simplest stories first.
D.
The increments will be reduced to enable faster product releases

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

Releasing a more basic version of a product early enables the company to obtain value from the work more quickly. With regard to planning, the team needs to figure out how to prioritize the backlog so that a product with basic functionality—and which also represents value to the customer—can enter the market.
The correct answer is: The backlog will be prioritized to deliver basic functionality in small increments.

Question 5

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Remove flag

Question text

The pandemic has caused delays which will make it very difficult to launch the new product on time. Television ads for the launch date are already purchased, so the CEO has asked the project manager to find a way to launch the product even if some minor features are NOT included.

Which measure would be the most effective step toward a successful and timely product launch?
Question 5 Answer
A.
Double the size of the test team to ensure that any defects will be detected and corrected as early as possible.
B.
Ask the team to remove product tests most likely to fail at first attempt and de-scope requirements relating to those tests.
C.
Fast-track the schedule and establish new test and readiness milestones as close as possible to the planned launch date. "
D.
Plan a parallel iterative track to develop requirements for a minimum viable product (MVP) and de-scope unnecessary predictive tasks.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

"The MVP is specifically intended to increase product success through customer feedback while accelerating development through minimizing effort. Schedule compression or scope reduction alone may be based on unneeded requirements."
The correct answer is: Plan a parallel iterative track to develop requirements for a minimum viable product (MVP) and de-scope unnecessary predictive tasks.

Question 6

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A complex project with high security protocols has key stakeholders located in the United States, France, and China. A senior manager requests confidential project information to be shared with a project partner.

Which step should the project manager take next?
Question 6 Answer
A.
Report this breach of ethics to the project governance committee.
B.
Supply the requested information but keep a record of the manager’s request.
C.
Supply the project information but ensure the sensitive parts are redacted.
D.
Check the communications management plan to verify whether the request is allowable.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

A communications management plan is developed to ensure that the appropriate messages are communicated to stakeholders in various formats and various means as deﬁned by the communication strategy. Even in a project with high security protocols, provisions may be in place to share information.
The correct answer is: Check the communications management plan to verify whether the request is allowable.

Question 7

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Remove flag

Question text

A project is delayed because the deliverables are NOT of acceptable quality. A change is required. First, the project manager issues a formal change request and communicates the change to all stakeholders. The stakeholders are NOT satisfied with this. They want a more detailed report about the nature of the delay.

What should the project manager do next?
Question 7 Answer
A.
Review the communications management plan and stakeholder engagement plan.
B.
Provide a change request to include stakeholder expectations in the project management plan.
C.
Organize a meeting with the project sponsor to better understand stakeholder expectations.
D.
Review the communications management plan, follow it, and issue a status report.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

The Monitor Communications and stakeholder engagement processes can trigger an iteration of the Plan Communications Management and/or Manage Communications processes to improve effectiveness of communication through additional and possibly amended communications plans and activities. Such iterations illustrate the continuous nature of the Communications Management and stakeholder engagement processes. Issues or key performance indicators, risks, or conﬂicts may trigger immediate revisions.
The correct answer is: Review the communications management plan and stakeholder engagement plan.

Question 8

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

The initial draft of a project management plan is completed. The project manager plans to show the draft to stakeholders for approval. The project manager has limited time to gain approval, the project management plan is lengthy, and stakeholders are located all over the world. The project manager needs to ensure that the review of the plan is completed on time.

Which action should the project manager take?
Question 8 Answer
A.
Send the plan for the stakeholders to review and then meet with all of them to discuss it.
B.
Ask each stakeholder to review the plan individually, add their comments, and then update the document accordingly.
C.
Ask select stakeholders to review particular sections of the plan based on their areas of expertise.
D.
Organize individual meetings with the stakeholders who are available during this time frame.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

The best approach is to send the draft of the project management plan in advance to the entire stakeholder team and then have a meeting to gain approval. Gaining approval from some, but not all, stakeholders, or getting approval of parts of the plan is less ideal.
The correct answer is: Send the plan for the stakeholders to review and then meet with all of them to discuss it.

Question 9

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A project’s single sponsor has been replaced by a steering committee due to a significant increase in project size.

How should the project manager approach this change?
Question 9 Answer
A.
Tailor communications to the new steering committee, recognizing that there has been a change in stakeholder structure.
B.
Follow the initial project plan, recognizing that the sponsor is the key stakeholder and the new committee members work in a lesser capacity.
C.
Schedule a low-key introductory meeting with the new steering committee and the team, while continuing to follow the initial project plan.
D.
Ensure that the new steering committee members receive the project’s current status report.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

The project manager needs to be proactive and respond to this change. The same communication that was planned for a single sponsor will NOT necessarily work for this steering committee.
The correct answer is: Tailor communications to the new steering committee, recognizing that there has been a change in stakeholder structure.

Question text

In response to slippage on some scheduled tasks, the project manager reprioritized a number of subsequent tasks to try to fix the problem. This did NOT work, so the project manager needs to escalate the issue.

Which two (2) items will the project manager need to consult? (Choose TWO).

Question 10 Answer
A.
Change management plan
B.
Stakeholder engagement plan
C.
Communications management plan
D.
Risk management plan
E.
Configuration management plan

Feedback

Your answer is partially correct.

"The slippage risk has become an issue, so now you need to handle the issue by escalation. The stakeholder engagement plan will tell you how to engage stakeholders, and the communications management plan helps to ensure that your messages are communicated to stakeholders in various formats and various means as deﬁned by the communication strategy."
The correct answers are: Stakeholder engagement plan, Communications management plan

Question text

Which two options should the project manager use? (Choose TWO).

Question 12

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00

Question text

An informal and unofficial blog was set up to enhance communication and morale among project team members. The project manager was NOT previously aware of the blog but has discovered that team members are using it inappropriately. It has caused some offense.

What should the project manager do?
Question 12 Answer
A.
Review the blog and assess the communications management plan.
B.
Reprimand all individuals involved and report the issue to the compliance office.
C.
Close down the blog, as it is NOT part of the communications management plan.
D.
Identify an administrator who can monitor communications on the blog.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

Communications outside of those covered by the communications management plan can lead to additional risks and issues.  However, since the team seemed to have a need for it, the project manager should assess the communications management plan for any gaps.  The project manager should also establish ground rules with the team for the blog.
The correct answer is: Review the blog and assess the communications management plan.

Question 13

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Remove flag

Question text

Members of a virtual agile team are separated by seven (7) time zones. Daily meetings are too long, and the problem is made worse when laptop cameras switch between the speaking members.

Which two measures should the project manager take to achieve shorter, more efficient daily meetings? (Choose TWO).

Question 13 Answer
A.
Use the iteration reviews to discuss the Kanban board.
B.
Require all members to stand during the full meeting.
C.
Place a single webcam to face the Kanban boards and teams.
D.
Ask the team members to raise blockers off-line.
E.
Limit speakers to only members who have made progress.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

Standing meetings limited to one webcam per group have been shown to reduce meeting times without losing efficiency.

1. Loại A vì mục đích của iteration review là review sản phẩm. hơn nữa daily là để cập nhật liên tục tiến độ của mọi người để từ đó thấy ngay được risk không hoàn thành plan sớm nhất

2. Bắt "đứng" trong môi trường online thì không được gì. Thường offline người ta bắt đứng để dể tập trung

3. Loại E do ai cũng phải made progress hoặc cập nhật cho người khác biết là đang có vấn đề gì.

C đúng do visualize thì nhanh hơn và dễ hình dung hơn, ít câu hỏi hơn

D đúng do blocker có thể được raise trước để mọi người đọc (offline). Thường thì sẽ trả lời 3 câu hỏi nhưng phương án D thì cho mọi người "trả lời trước" câu hỏi có gặp block gì không. thì sẽ tiết kiệm được thời gian nói và thời gian suy nghĩ action tiếp theo là gì để hỗ trợ người gặp blocker.

The correct answers are: Place a single webcam to face the Kanban boards and teams., Ask the team members to raise blockers off-line.

Question 14

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A project team has set up an unofficial online communications platform to enhance communication. The project manager was NOT aware that this platform existed until recently, after learning that its use has facilitated some activity that a stakeholder finds concerning.

Which action should the project manager take?
Question 14 Answer
A.
Advise the project team to stop using the platform and review the communications management plan.
B.
Log the issue and remind the individuals involved to use only authorized communications channels.
C.
Since it is NOT part of the communications management plan, terminate the platform.
D.
Delegate an administrator to monitor communications on this platform.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

Since this platform was NOT part of the original communications plan, it should NOT be used unless it can be added. However, you need to understand the stakeholder’s concern to evaluate whether it is valid. You also need to understand the reason why the team is communicating on an outside platform instead of the "approved" ones. Evaluate this use and the communication plan. If the team needs this, or a similar communication channel, in order to do their work, then you should find one that can offer the benefits they need.
The correct answer is: Advise the project team to stop using the platform and review the communications management plan.

Question 15

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

Project A is developing a customer service prototype for a company’s marketing department. The customer stakeholder group includes franchise owners and direct customers of the company. The prototype scores 95% on fulfillment of the functional requirements defined in the scope, which is a passing score in the project’s agreed quality metrics. The franchise group is unwilling to approve the prototype since it does NOT fulfill a particular functional requirement, but the direct customer group gives approval.

How can the project manager handle communication with this diverse stakeholder group?
Question 15 Answer
A.
Send a survey to each group asking for specific feedback on the prototype.
B.
Thank the customers for their approval; review the WBS and verify the requirements documentation with the franchise group.
C.
Hold a consultation with the franchise group, show them the direct customer approval, and negotiate for the approval.
D.
Check the RACI matrix for which group’s approval is needed and if still unclear, ask an executive stakeholder to make the final decision.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

At this phase of a project, the project team and stakeholders should benefit from good communications. Working directly with each stakeholder group—in this case thanking the direct customers and using project data to show the franchise group that the prototype fulfils both requirements and agreed quality metrics.

Đáp án B

Câu này đề nói là customer group bao gồm 2 người: direct customer và franchise. Mỗi người có thể có nhu cầu khác nhau mà người kia ko biết, chỉ có mình là trung gian thì mình biết hết, vì vậy sản phẩm làm ra phải có sự đồng ý của 2 hai người kia thì mới được (Ví dụ như người A chỉ yêu cầu tính năng A thì người này không biết gì để verify tính năng B do người khác yêu cầu).

Về RACI, thì thường ai approve gì sẽ có trong RACI. Nhưng mà vế sau mình tự quyết định là escalate cho người sếp quyền lớn hơn để approve là sai nguyên tắc về change. Hơn nữa trong đề này thì đã rõ nên không cần review RACI (loại D)

The correct answer is: Thank the customers for their approval; review the WBS and verify the requirements documentation with the franchise group.

Question 16

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

After a project delay, the project manager determines that a change is needed to the product deliverables in order to ensure quality. The project manager takes the following steps:
1. Issues a formal change request.
2. Communicates the change to all stakeholders.
3. Receives feedback that the communications approach did NOT meet stakeholders’ expectations.

What should the project manager do next?
Question 16 Answer
A.
Refer to the communications management plan and issue a status report.
B.
Ensure stakeholders’ expectations are included in the project management plan by issuing a change request.
C.
Hold a meeting with the project sponsor to better understand stakeholders’ expectations.
D.
Review the communications management and stakeholder engagement plans to see if the processes were followed.  An update to one or both plans might be warranted.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

The project manager should first verify if the processes were followed in communicating project changes to stakeholders. If they were, then the project manager should revise the communications and/or the stakeholder engagement plans based on stakeholder needs. These two plans help establish how communication will be managed and how the stakeholders will be engaged.
The correct answer is: Review the communications management and stakeholder engagement plans to see if the processes were followed.  An update to one or both plans might be warranted.

Question 17

Correct

Question text

As a result of multiple regulatory changes, a governmental agency is added as a key stakeholder on a complex project. The project manager wants to develop an understanding of this new stakeholder and identify any new high-level risks that may result from the change.

What should the project manager do?
Question 17 Answer
A.
Review the stakeholder engagement plan and verify the strategy for this change before meeting with the new stakeholder.
B.
Appoint an existing team member to lead compliance strategy and to liaise with this new stakeholder.
C.
Consult the change management plan to understand the next step in accepting this change.
D.
Check with the project sponsor to discuss how this new regulation and stakeholder might change the scope and budget for the project.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

Before meeting with the new stakeholder, you should review the stakeholder engagement plan and communication plan to verify the strategy for the change. The change includes a compliance issue, which you will need to understand and incorporate into project strategy. You need to do this first before allowing a team member to help. Finally, once you understand the change and talk with the new stakeholder, then you will know if a change to scope or budget is required.
The correct answer is: Review the stakeholder engagement plan and verify the strategy for this change before meeting with the new stakeholder.

A security-classified, agile software project requires outside expertise and delivery to add a module based on machine learning. An approved supplier asks the project manager to join the daily meeting with the supplier’s agile team, but the project manager’s schedule is too full with internal meetings.

Question 18 Answer

Question 19

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Remove flag

Question text

The latest software build for a virtual reality headset release did NOT include urgent change requests already implemented by the electronics work-stream. The product owner informed the software team about the change during a daily meeting, but NO ONE recorded it.

What should the project manager do to avoid this problem in the future?
Question 19 Answer
A.
Refine the product backlog with the team and product owner before the next iteration.
B.
Increase the frequency of backlog refinement meetings and note the change in the retrospective.
C.
Run an ad-hoc retrospective and add the agreed urgent change process to the team charter.
D.
Privately remind the team lead that the role requires fast and proactive problem solving.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

"In this case, iterative agile change handling is NOT fast enough. Continuous improvement in agile is achieved through retrospectives, and work processes are in the team charter. If you wait until the next iteration, it will be too late to catch the change; more frequent backlog refinements violate the principle of ""maximizing work not done""; and servant leaders would NOT impose on a team member to improvise."
The correct answer is: Run an ad-hoc retrospective and add the agreed urgent change process to the team charter.

Question 20

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Remove flag

Question text

A smart grid project combines predictive and agile tracks. The agile team detected a major software defect after its release and began working on a correction. But the defective release was deployed by the predictive track, and this caused a field test to fail.

Which measure would be most effective to prevent similar problems in the future?

Question 20 Answer
A.
Run the same unit tests in the agile lab and in the field sites.
B.
Send project-wide issue log updates via instant messaging.
C.
Ensure that retrospectives are shared with the predictive team.
D.
Replan the software track into the predictive schedule

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

The root problem is that impactful information in the agile team was NOT passed to the predictive team quickly enough to prevent the test failure. Instant messaging of issue log updates can reach the full project immediately after the issue is logged, and act as an alert.
The correct answer is: Send project-wide issue log updates via instant messaging.

Question text

A project is at the planning stage. The project manager realizes that producing a complex, multi-functional application is NOT feasible with the current number of resources and decides to hire more resources for the production of the application. The project manager identifies and contracts temporary resources.

Which risk response strategy does this scenario exemplify?
Question 21 Answer
A.
Mitigate
B.
Transfer
C.
Accept
D.
Avoid

Feedback

Your answer is incorrect.

The risk to the project was posed by insufficient resources. The risk was mitigated by hiring additional resources.
The correct answer is: Mitigate

Question 22

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A project is started with an approved scope. As the team implements the project design, a team member states that the product will NOT meet the requirements in certain situations. Correcting the issue increases both scope and costs, and the project will also miss the deadline. The project sponsors do NOT have additional funding to support the project.

What should the project manager do first?
Question 22 Answer
A.
Perform risk management analysis.
B.
Follow the Perform Integrated Change Control process.
C.
Crash the schedule.
D.
Contact the customer and negotiate for risk acceptance.

Feedback

The best option is: B. Follow the Perform Integrated Change Control process.


Explanation:

A. Perform risk management analysis.

Incorrectness: While performing a risk management analysis is a good practice to understand the potential risks and impacts, it is not the immediate first step when a specific issue has been identified that will affect scope, cost, and schedule. This option does not directly address the process of handling changes to project scope and constraints.


B. Follow the Perform Integrated Change Control process.

Correctness: The first step in handling a situation where correcting an issue affects the project’s scope, cost, and schedule is to follow the Perform Integrated Change Control process. This process involves evaluating the change’s impact on the project and obtaining necessary approvals from stakeholders or the change control board. This ensures that changes are systematically reviewed, documented, and approved before implementation, maintaining project governance and alignment with the approved scope and constraints.


C. Crash the schedule.

Incorrectness: Crashing the schedule involves adding resources to the project to accelerate the timeline. However, this option does not address the need to evaluate and approve changes to scope and cost, and it assumes that adding resources will resolve the issue without assessing the broader impact on the project.


D. Contact the customer and negotiate for risk acceptance.

Incorrectness: While negotiating with the customer for risk acceptance is part of risk management, it should come after a formal evaluation and approval of the change. This approach bypasses the necessary step of formally assessing and approving the change through the integrated change control process.


In conclusion, following the Perform Integrated Change Control process (Option B) is the best approach. It ensures that any proposed changes are thoroughly evaluated, documented, and approved, maintaining project governance and alignment with the project’s approved scope, cost, and schedule. This process helps in making informed decisions and keeps the project under control while addressing potential impacts.

The correct answer is: Follow the Perform Integrated Change Control process.

Question 23

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Remove flag

Question text

A project is being planned in a remote area with limited access to vehicles and equipment. Additionally, the road to the site goes through a protected area, and the government has required the company to sign a contract that they will protect the environment and road from damage. The project manager decides the best way to manage this risk is to deliver all heavy equipment themselves, despite the significant added expense.

What type of risk response is the project manager demonstrating?
Question 23 Answer
A.
Transfer
B.
Mitigate
C.
Accept
D.
Avoid

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

The project manager is mitigating the risk of violating the contract by including the delivery work in the scope and increasing budget to mitigate the risk of difficult access.

Accept: This strategy involves accepting the risk and not taking any action to address it. It is used when the risk is low or when the cost of addressing the risk is higher than the impact of the risk itself.

Trong câu hỏi này, mình có hành động để giảm impact nên accept là chưa phù hợp.

The correct answer is: Mitigate

Question text

A company is constructing recycling plants in fifteen (15) countries around the world. The lead in the project management office (PMO) wants more timely progress reporting and experience sharing between project managers in each of the geographically distant projects.

Which two agile methods might the PMO use to fulfill this need? (Choose TWO).
Question 24 Answer
A.
Definition of Done
B.
Electronic Kanban board
C.
Backlog refinement
D.
Virtual daily standup meetings
E.
2-week retrospective

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

A Kanban board would provide timely progress reporting, and bi-weekly retrospective calls would be a forum for sharing recent experiences and lessons for improvement. The Definition of Done is wrong because it focusses only on completion criteria, while backlog refinement and Scrum of Scrums would only be valid if all PMs are working on a common product.
The correct answers are: Electronic Kanban board, 2-week retrospective

Question 27 Answer
A.
B, A, D, C
B.
B, C, A, D
C.

D.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

Question 34

Incorrect
Mark 0.00 out of 1.00
Remove flag

Question text

Due to resource challenges, a contractor is late with a critical project deliverable, even though the work is nearly complete. The project must be delivered on time because the next projects depend on on-time completion of this one. There is a 22% buffer in the project budget for cost overruns, but only three (3) weeks left in the schedule.

How can the project manager resolve this issue?
Question 34 Answer
A.
Hire a new vendor to replace the current vendor.
B.
Use the buffer to look into alternative vendors that can assist with project deliverables and make use of the buffer.
C.
Hold a discussion with the vendor regarding the contractual implications of this slippage and negotiate for on-time completion.
D.
Escalate this issue to the project sponsor immediately.

Feedback

Overall feedback: With three weeks left and most of the work done, hiring a new vendor is NOT ideal. Since project delivery is the prime focus as well as budget for cost overruns, the project manager needs to assess alternatives without concern for the potential budget impact. Once a viable alternative is identified, they can present their case to the sponsor for a decision—but immediate escalation is NOT warranted.


Detailed feedback: Each option for resolving the issue of a contractor being late with a critical project deliverable due to resource challenges has its own implications. Here’s a detailed explanation of why each option is correct or incorrect:

A. Hire a new vendor to replace the current vendor.

  • This option might seem like a direct solution to the problem, but it involves several risks and complications. Hiring a new vendor, especially with only three weeks left in the schedule, could lead to further delays. The time required for a new vendor to understand project requirements, get up to speed, and start contributing effectively could extend well beyond the remaining project timeline. Additionally, this could also result in legal and financial implications due to breaking the contract with the current vendor.

B. Use the buffer to look into alternative vendors that can assist with project deliverables and make use of the buffer.

  • This option is practical and focuses on supplementing the existing vendor’s efforts rather than replacing them. Using the budget buffer to hire additional support can help meet the project deadline without the need to onboard a completely new vendor. This approach can provide the necessary resources to complete the project on time, assuming that the additional vendors can start contributing quickly. It balances the need for prompt action with the practicalities of the project’s time constraints.

C. Hold a discussion with the vendor regarding the contractual implications of this slippage and negotiate for on-time completion.

  • This option is both practical and constructive. Holding a discussion with the current vendor to negotiate on-time completion focuses on finding a solution while acknowledging the existing relationship and contractual obligations. This approach could lead to the vendor reallocating their resources or finding other ways to expedite the completion of the work. It is a direct way to address the issue without immediately resorting to financial or legal leverage, promoting a collaborative solution.

D. Escalate this issue to the project sponsor immediately.

  • While escalating the issue to the project sponsor is a viable option, it should not necessarily be the first step. Escalation is typically reserved for when other avenues have been explored or when the issue’s magnitude justifies senior management intervention. Immediate escalation might bypass potential resolutions with the vendor and could potentially alarm project stakeholders unnecessarily.

Correct Approach: Options B and C are the most constructive and practical approaches to resolving the issue, with Option C being the most direct and potentially least disruptive. It encourages collaboration and problem-solving with the current vendor, which is already familiar with the project’s requirements. If negotiations with the current vendor fail to yield a satisfactory solution, then Option B becomes a viable fallback to utilize the budget buffer effectively for assistance without completely disrupting the vendor relationship. Option A and Option D may be considered more drastic or premature given the context provided.


The correct answer is: Hold a discussion with the vendor regarding the contractual implications of this slippage and negotiate for on-time completion.

Question text

Question 44 Answer

B.
Review the assumption log to revisit or change current assumptions.
C.
Confirm that an implemented risk response is effective.
D.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

In this case, the risk was missed deadlines, and the response to the risk was to change suppliers. Part of an effective risk management strategy is making sure that the risk response is effective—in this case, that the replacement supplier would supply quality glass on time. The Monitor Risks process uses performance information generated during project execution to determine if the response was effective. In this case, the response was NOT effective.

=> Giải thích thêm của Atoha:
Lựa chọn A sai vì A là “Update the risk information to the lessons learned register.” chứ không phải là update kết quả thực hiện của risk response.

Sau đó lưu lại LL register. Đến cuối dự án cho vào OPA. Rồi dự án sau thì xem lại LL register/OPA là có thể prevent the same issue

Câu hỏi là PM cần làm gì để tránh điều này trong tương lai. Tình huống là ông vendor đầu miss deadline => risk xảy ra => apply risk response => thay vendor khác => Nhưng không kiểm tra liệu vendor này có ổn không => bị issue về quality.

Để tránh điều này thì PM cần check lại risk response có hiệu quả k => check quality của ông 2.

Khi confirm risk response is effective thì sẽ biết đc yes hoặc no

Nếu No thì PM cần take action tiếp.

Ý chính của câu này là sau này trong lúc  implement risk response thì nhớ monitor cái risk đó để biết phương án ứng phó rủi ro có hiệu quả hay không. Chứ đừng implement mà không monitor nó.

The correct answer is: Confirm that an implemented risk response is effective.

Question 53

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Remove flag

Question text

During work on a government project, stakeholders exert pressure on the project manager to comply with their preferred actions because they have extremely complex regulations and constraints. The project manager wants to build a successful relationship with these stakeholders because the company hopes to win more contracts with the government.

Which two approaches should the project manager take? (Choose TWO).
Question 53 Answer
A.
Assess and categorize these stakeholders using the Salience model.
B.
Invite these stakeholders to team meetings to assure them that the project team takes their work seriously.
C.
Send a questionnaire out to this stakeholder group, asking about their needs.
D.
Use servant leadership to build a relationship based on stakeholder needs.
E.
Share the stakeholder engagement matrix with the team.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

Both leadership and analytical project management tools are important in this scenario. The stakeholders need to earn trust in your team, but you—NOT the team—are the main point of contact. The best choice to facilitate trust is an effective leadership style that emphasizes the needs of your stakeholders. Since the project has started, you should already know their needs, so a questionnaire is NOT helpful. However, you need information about the stakeholders. In a complex environment such as this one, the salience model of categorization is a good choice, as it helps leaders navigate frequently changing, complex relationships that involve several parties.

Giải thích thêm đáp án Use servant leadership to build a relationship based on stakeholder needs.

Lãnh đạo đầy tớ là người lãnh đạo mà vai trò đầu tiên là phục vụ những người xung quanh. Lãnh đạo đầy tớ không chỉ tiếp cận toàn diện với công việc, thúc đẩy nhận thức của nhân viên, chia sẻ quyền lực mà còn đặt nhu cầu và quyền lợi của nhân viên lên hàng đầu, đồng thời giúp mọi người phát triển một cách tốt nhất có thể trong điều kiện cho phép. Lãnh đạo phục vụ bao gồm 2 phần “lãnh đạo” – tạo ra tầm nhìn, giá trị và mục tiêu cho tổ chức, đồng thời hướng dẫn, nâng đỡ nhân viên cấp dưới nhằm đạt được kết quả mong đợi/vượt quá kỳ vọng và “phục vụ” – hỗ trợ đắc lực cho nhân viên, tạo sự gắn kết và phát triển cho chính bản thân họ và rộng ra là doanh nghiệp, tạo sự chia sẻ về quyền lợi và trách nhiệm để mọi quyết định và hành động đều xuất phát từ sự đồng thuận chung. 

Tham khảo hai bài viết của Atoha để rõ ràng hơn về vai trò & lợi ích của Servant Leader.

2/ https://www.atoha.com/blogs/kien-thuc/nhung-lam-tuong-va-quan-niem-sai-lam-ve-servant-leadership 

The correct answers are: Assess and categorize these stakeholders using the Salience model., Use servant leadership to build a relationship based on stakeholder needs.

Question 57

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

Several new members are added to an ongoing project. Although all original team members received basic training on the specifics of the business operation that the project supports, the new members do NOT have the same basic understanding. This lack of understanding results in decreased productivity.

How should the project manager respond to this issue?

Question 57 Answer
A.
Ask the original team members to provide support and training and schedule a second kick-off meeting for new team members.
B.
Assure all new team members that they should feel comfortable asking for help from both the long-term members and project manager.
C.
Revise the team, so that the newer resources are moved to other projects and resources with relevant experience are added, then log lessons learned.
D.
Recognize that this is a common occurrence when teams experience changes and revise the schedule to allow for the slight decrease in productivity.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

It is the project manager’s responsibility to make sure that the new members are adequately trained. This approach provides that training.

=> More explanation from Atoha: 
Each option for responding to the issue of decreased productivity due to new team members lacking basic understanding of the business operation involves a different approach. Here’s an analysis of why each option is correct or incorrect:

A. Ask the original team members to provide support and training and schedule a second kick-off meeting for new team members.

  • This option is proactive and directly addresses the root cause of the productivity issue. By providing the new members with the necessary training and support, the project manager ensures that they gain a basic understanding of the business operation, thus aligning their knowledge with that of the original team members. Scheduling a second kick-off meeting specifically for the new members can further integrate them into the project, reinforcing team cohesion and ensuring everyone has a shared understanding of the project’s objectives and the business context. This approach is effective in mitigating the productivity loss and fostering a collaborative team environment.

B. Assure all new team members that they should feel comfortable asking for help from both the long-term members and project manager.

  • While creating a supportive environment where new team members feel comfortable asking for help is important, this option is somewhat passive and does not proactively ensure that all new members acquire the necessary business operation knowledge. It relies on the new members’ initiative to seek help, which may not be sufficient for them to catch up quickly or effectively. While beneficial for building a supportive team culture, this approach alone may not fully resolve the underlying issue of decreased productivity due to a lack of understanding.

C. Revise the team, so that the newer resources are moved to other projects and resources with relevant experience are added, then log lessons learned.

  • This approach might seem like a quick fix to the productivity issue but can have negative implications for team morale and project continuity. Moving new members to other projects and bringing in new resources could cause disruption, delay, and potentially harm the learning culture within the team. Moreover, it doesn’t address the need for ongoing learning and adaptation within the project team. Logging lessons learned is valuable for future reference but does not address the immediate issue at hand.

D. Recognize that this is a common occurrence when teams experience changes and revise the schedule to allow for the slight decrease in productivity.

  • Acknowledging the impact of team changes on productivity and adjusting the schedule accordingly is a pragmatic approach. However, this option addresses the symptom (decreased productivity) rather than the root cause (lack of understanding of the business operation). While it may provide short-term relief by making project timelines more realistic, it does not ensure that the new team members develop the necessary understanding to contribute effectively in the long term.

Correct Approach: Option A, asking the original team members to provide support and training and scheduling a second kick-off meeting for new team members, is the most comprehensive and effective way to address the issue. It ensures that new members are properly integrated into the project team with the necessary understanding of the business operation, directly tackling the cause of decreased productivity.

The correct answer is: Ask the original team members to provide support and training and schedule a second kick-off meeting for new team members.

Question 59

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Remove flag

Question text

A deliverable on the project’s critical path is behind schedule. The cost performance index (CPI) is 1.3. The project manager is able to put the project back on schedule.

Which three results are the most likely for this project? (Choose THREE).
Question 59 Answer
A.
Activities will be performed in parallel.
B.
Project scope will be revised.
C.
Associated risks will increase.
D.
Costs will increase.
E.
The team should expect rework.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

The cost performance index (CPI) is above 1; therefore, the project is spending money at a rate lower than planned. Since the project is behind schedule, its schedule performance index (SPI) is less than 1. In order to increase the SPI to 1, there will most likely be an increase in costs, perhaps from crashing activities on the critical path that will lower the CPI towards 1. This will most likely increase risks associated with the project when trying to do more in a shorter time.

=> Giải thích thêm của Atoha:
Tình huống của dự án là Cost performance đang tốt, có thừa tiền để nén tiến độ bằng Crashing. Đề bài đang đề cập về behind schedule và cần “put the project back on schedule”. Có 2 giải pháp nén tiến độ là:- Crashing: ok thoải mái vì CPI đang tốt (CPI = 1.3). Khi crashing thì tăng risk và tăng cost. Nên C và D là 2 phương án đúng.
- Fast Tracking: lựa chọn A là lựa chọn đúng mô tả của Fast tracking. Lựa chọn E là hệ quả của fast tracking. Nên nếu chọn giữa A và E thì sẽ chọn A vì nó đúng trực tiếp, còn E chỉ là hệ quả của fast tracking và “may result in rework” chứ không phải lúc nào cũng rework.
Do đó nếu choose THREE thì đáp án là C, D, A. Nếu choose FOUR thì đáp án là C, D, A, E
The correct answers are: Activities will be performed in parallel., Associated risks will increase., Costs will increase.

Question 60

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A project that should have been 90% complete by now is only 65% complete. The total project budget is US$120,000 and the actual cost spent to date (AC) is US$80,000.

What is the scheduled performance index (SPI) and cost performance index (CPI) of this project?
Question 60 Answer
A.
The SPI is 0.72, and the CPI is 0.98.
B.
The SPI is 1.38, and the CPI is 1.2.
C.
The SPI is 0.94, and the CPI is 1.04.
D.
The SPI is 0.80, and the CPI is 0.91.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

"EV = % complete * budget: 65% * $120,000 = $78,000,
AC = $80,000.
CPI = EV/AC = $78,000/80,000 = 0.975 or 0.98  
A CPI less than 1 means the project is over budget.

PV = % complete * budget: 90% * $120,000 = $108,000,
SPI = EV/PV = $78,000/108,000 = 0.72  
An SPI less than 1 means the project is behind schedule. "
The correct answer is: The SPI is 0.72, and the CPI is 0.98.

Question 62

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A project has the following characteristics:
- US$3 million budget.
- Planned value of US$630,000.
- Actual cost of US$650,000.
- Earned value of US$540,000.

Which statement is true about the current status of the project?
Question 62 Answer
A.
The project is ahead of schedule and under budget.
B.
The project is behind schedule and over budget.
C.
The project is ahead of schedule and over budget.
D.
The project is behind schedule and under budget.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

"CV = EV - AC: 540 - 650 = -110 (negative cost variance)
SV = EV - PV: 540 - 630 = -90 (negative schedule variance)

Negative cost variance means the project is over budget.
Negative schedule variance means project is behind schedule."
The correct answer is: The project is behind schedule and over budget.

Question text

A project that should have been 70% complete by now is only 55% complete. The total project budget is US$210,000, and the actual cost spent to date is US$162,000.

What is the scheduled performance index (SPI) and cost performance index (CPI) of this project?
Question 64 Answer
A.
The SPI is 0.79, and the CPI is 0.71.

Question 70

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A project manager is uncertain about the duration of a project for a new product and consults several groups of subject matter experts (SMEs).

The first group advises that development can be finished in 40 days.
The second group identifies some risks that could make the duration up to 60 days.
The third group proposes a new development method that can shorten the time to 20 days.

What is the estimated development duration for the new product?
Question 70 Answer
A.
20 days
B.
40 days
C.
60 days
D.
30 days

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

"Using three-point estimating (Triangular Estimate) = (Optimistic + Most Likely + Pessimistic)/3 = (20 + 40 + 60)/3 = 120/3 = 40 days

Beta Estimate = (Optimistic + (4 X Most Likely) + Pessimistic)/6 = (20 + (4*40) + 60)/6 = 240/6 = 40 days "
The correct answer is: 40 days

When stories CANNOT be completed within one iteration, it is typically because the story is NOT broken down into small enough goals.

Question 76

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

Two start-up companies have merged, and now more than 100 developers on eight agile teams are working on a common portfolio.

Which agile practice or method can best ensure release coordination between the teams?

Question 76 Answer
A.
Scrum of Scrums
B.
Mobbing
C.
Scrumban
D.
Feature-Driven Development

Feedback

Scrum of Scrums. A technique to operate Scrum at scale for multiple teams working on the same product, coordinating discussions of progress on their interdependencies, and focusing on how to integrate the delivery of software, especially in areas of overlap.

Scrum of Scrums (SoS), also known as “meta Scrum,” is a technique used when two or more Scrum teams consisting of three to nine members each need to coordinate their work instead of one large Scrum team. A representative from each team attends a meeting with the other team representative(s), potentially daily but typically two to three times a week. The daily meeting is conducted similar to the daily standup in Scrum where the representative reports completed work, next set of work, any current impediments, and potential upcoming impediments that might block the other team(s). The goal is to ensure the teams are coordinating work and removing impediments to optimize the efficiency of all the teams.

Large projects with several teams may result in conducting a Scrum of Scrum of Scrums, which follows the same pattern as SoS with a representative from each SoS reporting into a larger group of representatives 

Feature-Driven Development. A lightweight agile software development method driven from the perspective of features valued by clients.

The correct answer is: Scrum of Scrums

Question 82

Question text

A hybrid virtual reality project is running an agile software track and a predictive electronics track. Halfway into the project, delays are accumulating due to misaligned deliverable releases between the two tracks.

Which two elements should the project manager combine to produce a common network diagram? (Choose TWO).
Question 82 Answer
A.
Definition of Ready with dependency milestones
B.
Epic breakdown with work breakdown structure
C.
Product backlog with critical path task sequence
D.
Definition of Done with exit criteria
E.
Definition of Ready with work breakdown structure

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

Question 83

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A hybrid municipal waste management project combines many brief administrative tasks with small-scale public works. An agile track makes good progress on key objectives, but small tasks are accumulating in the backlog. Most tasks can be done in one day but are dependent on unpredictable triggering events.

Which approach would be most effective to clear out these minor tasks faster?
Question 83 Answer
A.
Combine multiple minor tasks to make story sizes consistent with key objectives.
B.
Reprioritize the backlog to favor the smallest stories and reassign them daily.
C.
Reprioritize the backlog on a daily basis so that recent triggers boost story priority.
D.
Integrate the small tasks to either the Definition of Done or acceptance criteria.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

The stories will NOT be considered complete until associated small tasks are triggered and completed.

Câu này có thể loại đáp án B,C trước vì việc reprioritize the backlog dựa trên value deliver để team có thể tối đa hóa được value cho KH một cách nhanh nhất có thể. Và thứ tự ưu tiên là các user stories có High value/High risk sẽ ưu tiên làm đầu. Nên không thể nói là việc reprioritize the backlog là ưu tiên cho các User Stories nhỏ nhất. Và ngoài ra việc liên tục reprioritize the backlog on daily, reassign daily sẽ có thể dẫn tới sự nhầm lẫn và không hiệu quả, team có thể không có sự tập trung khi phải liên tục làm việc này. Và nó cũng đi ngược lại mục đích của việc reprioritize the backlog theo timebox của một iteration. 

Loại đáp án A tiếp vì cách Agile approach hay Scrum method thì chúng ta không làm việc combining các tasks vì điều này sẽ làm cho các tasks trở nên lớn hơn và độ phức tạp sẽ cao hơn, khó thực hiện việc ưu tiên các task. Ngược lại chúng ta cần phải decompose hay slicing stories thành các tasks nhỏ để xử lý dễ dàng hơn. 

Đáp án D là chính xác vì các task ở đây là dependent on unpredictable triggering events, nên chúng ta cần phải gắn vào một tiêu chí hoàn thành (DoD) hoặc tiêu chí chấp nhận (acceptance criteria). Thì lúc này các tasks sẽ có những yêu cầu hoàn thành cụ thể để cho các team hiểu và xử lý được nhanh hơn, nó đúng với tình huống của câu hỏi là most effective to clear out these minor tasks faster. Đồng thời cũng sẽ giúp việc quản lý các task trong backlog tốt hơn với các task có unpredictable. Với cách thức này thì các task cũng sẽ được check và không bị bỏ qua hoặc liên tục bị đẩy xuống cuối danh sách ưu tiên trong backlog.

The correct answer is: Integrate the small tasks to either the Definition of Done or acceptance criteria.

Question 95

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

During Project A’s kickoff phase, the project manager provided training for the entire team regarding the specifics of the company operations that the project supports. A year later, project productivity is suffering because members who were added later in the project do NOT have the same level of understanding.

How should the project manager respond to this challenge?
Question 95 Answer
A.
Tell the newer team members to ask for help from the long-term members when they run into things they do not understand.
B.
Ask current team members to provide training and support and hold a second kick-off meeting for new team members.
C.
Add new members who have the relevant experience, reassign the newer team members, and log turnover issues in the lessons learned register.
D.
Recognize that this is a natural project progression and revise the schedule to allow for the slight decrease in productivity.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

It is the project manager’s responsibility to make sure that the new members are adequately trained. This approach provides that training.


=> More explanation from Atoha:
This challenge of integrating new team members who lack the same level of understanding as original team members about the company operations the project supports, leading to decreased productivity, requires a strategic and inclusive approach. Here’s why each option is correct or incorrect:

A. Tell the newer team members to ask for help from the long-term members when they run into things they do not understand.

  • This option encourages a culture of asking for help, which is positive, but it’s a passive approach to knowledge transfer. It relies on new team members identifying gaps in their knowledge and seeking out assistance, which might not happen consistently or effectively. This approach does not proactively ensure that all team members have the necessary level of understanding, which could lead to gaps in knowledge and continued decreases in productivity.

B. Ask current team members to provide training and support and hold a second kick-off meeting for new team members.

  • This option is proactive and directly addresses the issue by ensuring that new team members receive the necessary training and support to understand the specifics of the company operations. Holding a second kick-off meeting for new team members can help integrate them into the project, aligning their understanding with that of the original team members. This approach not only addresses the immediate productivity concerns but also strengthens the team’s cohesion and shared understanding of the project goals and context.

C. Add new members who have the relevant experience, reassign the newer team members, and log turnover issues in the lessons learned register.

  • While adding experienced new members could potentially address the knowledge gap, reassigning newer team members because they lack specific knowledge is not a constructive solution. It could disrupt team dynamics and ignore the opportunity for growth and learning. Logging turnover issues in the lessons learned register is useful for future projects but does not address the current challenge of ensuring all team members have the necessary understanding to contribute effectively.

D. Recognize that this is a natural project progression and revise the schedule to allow for the slight decrease in productivity.

  • Acknowledging changes in team composition and adjusting the project schedule can be part of managing a project. However, this option accepts decreased productivity as an inevitable outcome without addressing the underlying issue of unequal understanding among team members. It’s a reactive measure that fails to capitalize on the opportunity to improve team capabilities and project outcomes through targeted training and integration efforts.

Correct Approach: Option B, asking current team members to provide training and support and holding a second kick-off meeting for new team members, is the most effective response to this challenge. It actively seeks to elevate the knowledge and understanding of new team members, directly addressing the cause of decreased productivity and fostering a unified, well-informed project team.


The correct answer is: Ask current team members to provide training and support and hold a second kick-off meeting for new team members.

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A technology development project has the following characteristics: It requires a highly skilled resource that is unavailable locally. The project manager has identified a resource who can do the work, but the resource lives in a different country and requires a work visa. The work visa process is taking more time than anticipated.

B.
Reduce the project scope.
C.
Delay the project by an equivalent duration.
D.
Request that the resource work remotely.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

The use of virtual teams creates new possibilities when acquiring project team members. Virtual teams can be deﬁned as groups of people with a shared goal who fulfill their roles with little or no time spent meeting face to face. The availability of communication technology such as email, audio conferencing, social media, web-based meetings, and video conferencing has made virtual teams feasible.
The correct answer is: Request that the resource work remotely.

Question text

Question 116

Partially correct
Mark 0.50 out of 1.00
Remove flag

Question text

The atmosphere is tense in the sprint planning review. The agile team members are visibly unhappy—one of them kicks a chair and shouts at the product owner, "That just doesn’t make sense!"

Which two actions should the project manager take in this situation? (Choose TWO.)
Question 116 Answer
A.
Remind the team of the product owner’s responsibilities and authority.
B.
Calm all present by asking them to call on their emotional intelligence.
C.
Intervene, giving one uninterrupted minute to each person present to state their case.
D.
Reprimand the member who kicked the chair with a warning.
E.
Facilitate by asking the team to suggest ways to resolve the points of dispute.

Feedback

Your answer is partially correct.

The project manager is addressing the conflict with a collaborate/problem approach, first ensuring all viewpoints are expressed and then inviting suggestions on how to resolve the dispute. If you remind the team about one person’s authority and/or reprimand the protesting member, you are using a force/direct approach, which is not compatible with agile principles, and which is, in any case, a last resort. On the other hand, if you only calm or placate, then you may NOT reach a compromise, which is the goal.
The correct answers are: Intervene, giving one uninterrupted minute to each person present to state their case., Facilitate by asking the team to suggest ways to resolve the points of dispute.

Question 118

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A Scrum innovation team is funded at varying levels by six (6) market units. Four (4) niche market units complain they are neglected because the team prioritizes mainstream unit goals. The marketing director suggests devoting a constant 40% of the team effort to the four (4) niche units in a balanced way.

How can the team support this request?
Question 118 Answer
A.
Group stories by unit; select 40% of niche stories to work on at each sprint.
B.
Split stories into mainstream or niche groups; plan 40% of niche story points at each sprint
C.
Group stories by unit; plan 10% of story points per niche unit at each sprint
D.
Split stories into mainstream or niche groups, plan 10% of mainstream stories at each sprint

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

The requirement is to devote 40% of effort (story points) to each of the four (4) niche units at every iteration.

Group by unit: 4 niche + 6 mainstream

40% story points / 4 units = 10%

Tình huống trong câu hỏi này nói đến việc scrum team thực hiện các công việc với 6 đơn vị nghiệp vụ (4 niche + 2 mainstream) + có request cần phải đảm bảo được 40% nỗ lực của scrum team để thực hiện công việc theo yêu cầu của 4 niche team (cần cân bằng) -> Nỗ lực thực hiện cho mỗi niche team là 40%/4 = 10%

Các đáp án mà "Split stories into mainstream or niche groups" thì có nghĩa là: công việc của 2 mainstream team được gom chung vào 1 backlog + công việc của 4 niche team được gom chung vào 1 backlog -> 40% nỗ lực cho niche team sẽ không chắc chắn được chia đều cho 4 team mà sẽ dựa vào ưu tiên của backlog -> Do vậy thì không gom các niche team để tạo thành group có backlog chung được

The correct answer is: Group stories by unit; plan 10% of story points per niche unit at each sprint

Question 124

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

The project manager receives a progress report showing that the agile project is NOT on track. Since all work was deliberately selected and sequenced to meet higher-level objectives, the project manager is surprised by the report.

In the future, how can the project manager prevent this type of miscommunication?
Question 124 Answer
A.
Support self-organization for the project team and help them provide buy-in for the project.
B.
Ensure that there is a contingency reserve to cover these issues.
C.
Ensure that the team is trained to use the agile process reporting system.
D.
Provide early training and ongoing mentoring about the agile approach for the project team.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

"For agile projects, rather than a project manager selecting and sequencing work, higher-level objectives are explained, and the team members are empowered to self-organize specific tasks as a group to best meet those objectives. This leads to the creation of practical plans with high levels of buy-in from the team members."

Tình huống ở đây là PM đã nhận được report và theo cái cách mà ông PM đang expecting là "all work was deliberately selected and sequenced to meet higher-level objectives". Mặc dù dự án Agile nó có liên quan theo cái expecting của ông PM nhưng mà việc lựa chọn cũng phải dựa trên độ ưu tiên của user stories, tasks và feedback của customers, tức là độ khả năng thích ứng và đáp ứng để thay đổi ( welcome change). Chính vì thế trong các Iterations (Sprints) đâu đó sẽ có những thay đổi độ ưu tiên của các user stories và các new requirement ảnh hưởng đến dự án và có thể làm cho dự án NOT on track. Nên ở đây đang xảy ra tình huống miscommunication của ông PM với report của team, chứ không thể nói nói report này bị sai và ông PM không nắm được status của dự án.

The correct answer is: Support self-organization for the project team and help them provide buy-in for the project.

Question 148

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A project team is working with an overseas contractor based in a country that has three official languages, and every contractor on the team is multilingual. Team meetings continue to be held in the commonly shared language, but during project work meetings, contractors speak to each other in a different language. When the project manager brings this up in the next team meeting, the contractors express regret, but they explain that they work better when they can communicate freely with each other.

How should the project manager respond first?
Question 148 Answer
A.
Require everyone to speak the same language all of the time, even though this will slow the pace of work.
B.
Escalate this as an issue to the human resources department.
C.
Obtain formal training or translation services.
D.
Let the team discuss language requirements and make ground rules for team communication.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

In this case, forcing the contractors to work less efficiently may jeopardize the project. Work with the whole team to find the best solution that will NOT jeopardize the project. Escalation is NOT required unless the team is unable to find a solution. Teams need to acknowledge the diversity of its members and promote an environment of inclusiveness. Each team is unique in its character, makeup, and tolerance levels, but the high-performing teams are self-aware.  Commonly agreed ground rules always make together easier, especially in heterogeneous groups.
The correct answer is: Let the team discuss language requirements and make ground rules for team communication.

Question text

Question 150 Answer
A.

B.

This option would involve working with the product owner to prioritize the iteration backlog, so that the most critical tasks are completed first and the work of the other team is not impacted. This would help ensure that the project stays on track and that the team is able to meet the required deadlines.

A.
Notify the project sponsor about the lack of a technical resource.
B.
Immediately escalate the issue to decision makers in the organization. "
C.
Check with the technical resource manager to see if there is an available technical resource.
D.
Hire an outside party to meet the need for a technical resource.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

The project manager should first confirm with the technical resource manager whether a resource is available.
The correct answer is: Check with the technical resource manager to see if there is an available technical resource.

Question text

A project manager in a virtual team realizes, during the third iteration of product development, that the team dashboard that shows progress on work is faulty and is NOT showing updates.

Which action should the project manager take?
Question 152 Answer
A.
Keep the team working and send daily email updates to the team.
B.
Rank the need to fix the dashboard according to the business value for upcoming iterations.
C.
Get the dashboard fixed.
D.
Document the issue as a new project risk and propose a solution.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

In an agile virtual team, the project manager needs to keep work visible so that the team can see progress. This is essential. Changing the way the team works together in the middle of a project can be very disruptive. In this case, they are lucky that a problem did NOT arise. The project manager needs to protect the team against impediments and allow them to focus on their work.
The correct answer is: Get the dashboard fixed.

Question text

Project D is working virtually because of a recent natural disaster. Several activities are delayed because a project team member has NOT been working for the past week. This impacts the critical path.

How should the project manager respond to this problem?
Question 153 Answer
A.
Obtain a new resource to complete the needed tasks until you can speak to the team member directly.
B.
Discuss the situation with the team member’s functional manager and enable them to manage the team member.
C.

Question 154

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

During an iteration, a project team working in country B encounters problems that may cause a delay in completion of task B. Teams in country A need task B to be completed on time in order to meet their schedules. These teams work together virtually.

What can the project manager do to resolve this problem?
Question 154 Answer
A.
Ask the team in country B to work harder to complete on time, in order to avoid delaying the work of other teams.
B.
Ask the teams to collaborate virtually to find a solution to avert the potential delay.
C.
Increase the iteration length, and add additional resources to the project team, so that they can meet the appropriate deadlines.
D.
Ask team members to perform to the best of their abilities during the iteration and engage in a retrospective after completion of the iteration.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

“May cause a delay” does NOT mean the task completion will be delayed. To improve the probability of success, the team should collaborate and find a solution. They know their work best, and despite working virtually, they should be able to find a solution.
The correct answer is: Ask the teams to collaborate virtually to find a solution to avert the potential delay.

Question 155

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Remove flag

Question text

A new project manager needs to deliver a high-stakes agile project. The vendor working with the team is in another country. Though this vendor has delivered excellent quality work on time in the past, they are currently behind schedule.

The team explains to the project manager that their attempts to get the vendor back on schedule have failed. They have sent emails and phoned, but the vendor only gives vague, noncommittal responses.

The product owner insists that this vendor is essential to the success of the project and an important partner of the business.

Which action should the project manager take?
Question 155 Answer
A.
Contact the vendor and be direct about the consequences of their actions and delays
B.
Create a virtual workspace for the team so that everyone is aware of and accountable for their tasks and aware of due dates. Include the product owner.
C.
Work with procurement to amend the vendor’s service agreement, with specific terms and conditions for work.
D.
Ask the product owner to use personal influence to get the vendor back on schedule.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

Communication in virtual teams can be challenging. Being direct may NOT leave a good first impression and revising a service agreement may be perceived as hostile by the vendor. This vendor is critical to the success of the project and important to the business, and the team may be getting demoralized by their unsuccessful attempts to manage the vendor. Be attentive of these factors using active listening and emotional intelligence. Creating a workspace that enables everyone on the project team to see the project work and be accountable for delivering their work on time is the best option here. Including the product owner in the virtual work space as an informed party is wise.

The correct answer is: B. Create a virtual workspace for the team so that everyone is aware of and accountable for their tasks and aware of due dates. Include the product owner.

Virtual workspace for the team ở đây mình có thể hiểu là vừa cho the team + vendor của mình luôn. Vì ngữ cảnh ở đây có một vài ý "The vendor working with the team is in another country"; "this vendor is essential to the success of the project and an important partner of the business" nên việc tạo virtual workspace cho team dự án là tối ưu nhất trong ngữ cảnh này. Mình cũng có thể đi loại trừ các phương án khác: 

- Câu A: "direct" là phương pháp không ổn, chưa proactive 

- Câu C: "this vendor has delivered excellent quality work on time in the past" là một ý, ý thứ 2 ngữ cảnh câu này tập trung vào communication/interaction issues là nhiều hơn performance của vendor

- Câu D: "influence" không thì vẫn chưa đủ, cần resolve impediments của toàn team

The correct answer is: Create a virtual workspace for the team so that everyone is aware of and accountable for their tasks and aware of due dates. Include the product owner.

Question 156

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

A longstanding, key team member in a virtual team has been unmotivated for weeks after the death of a family member. Because of this, several project activities are behind schedule, impacting the project’s critical path.

How should the project manager handle this situation?
Question 156 Answer
A.
Replace the team member.
B.
Discuss the situation with the team member and work with them to identify a workable solution.
C.
Escalate this situation as an HR issue and ask other team members to work overtime.
D.
Ask the functional manager for additional support on the project, including assignment of a new resource.

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

A project manager is a servant leader. Servant leadership means listening and acting with empathy. Especially in virtual teams, facilitating servant leadership can be a challenge. Replacing the key team member is a unilateral action that project team members and others may perceive as drastic, considering the circumstances. Asking others, such as HR or the functional manager, to intervene is a good idea, but the team member should be consulted first, and asking the team to work overtime is always a gamble. Given all of this, the project is the priority here. Speak with the team member first, using emotional intelligence and empathy, but with a firm approach to completion of work as a priority.
The correct answer is: Discuss the situation with the team member and work with them to identify a workable solution.

Question text

=> Câu này mình có thể dựa vào ngữ cảnh để chọn C hoặc dùng phương pháp loại trừ.

---> Tinh giản quy trình (Streamline procedure) và đảm bảo rằng đội ngũ dự án được huấn luyện về quy trình này.


Loại trừ:

A. Việc tổ chức team event không liên quan đến cải thiện quy trình và thông thường Servant Leadership thường đóng vai trò "coaching" team members và "facilitate" để "self managing" team tự giải quyết.

B. Mỗi interation (sprint) ít nhất mình phải deliver 01 increment (meet definifion of done, valuate, usable), sẽ không có việc dành ra một sprint để training, testing, integration, ...

D. Việc tăng user story point để cover việc chậm trễ của process là không hợp lý & có thể ảnh hưởng đến forecast của team sau này


The correct answer is: Work with process owners to streamline procedure and secure the team coaching on the processes.

Question text

A project manager with limited experience managing globally distributed team members is appointed to a project with team members who are all from another country and speak a different native language. To successfully manage this project, the project manager needs to have cultural sensitivity.

What of the following actions should the project manager NOT take?"

Question 160

Correct
Mark 1.00 out of 1.00
Flag question

Question text

Several unforeseen impediments suddenly appear on the Kanban board in a hybrid project. Each team member has reported one or more different problems relating to a regulatory specification issued by the predictive track.

Which parameter is likely to be highest in the risk assessment?
Question 160 Answer
A.
Manageability
B.
Dormancy
C.
Connectivity
D.
Controllability

Feedback

Your answer is correct.

"The risks are all related to a common source—the specification—so connectivity ranks high per the definition ""Where a risk is connected to many other risks, connectivity is high"". Manageability and controllability are INCORRECT because the risk factor depends on an external regulator. Dormancy is low because the risks were detected immediately after the specification was issued."

Khi quản lý risk có nhiều yếu tố cũng có thể được xem xét đánh giá bên cạnh impact, probability như là Urgency, Proximity, Dormancy, Manageability, Controllability, Connectivity,...

Mỗi yếu tố thì có những sự ảnh hưởng khác nhau đến việc đánh giá mức độ ưu tiên của các risk.

Học viên có thể tham khảo 2 link sau để hiểu về các yếu tố này: https://www.atoha.com/blogs/kien-thuc/quan-ly-rui-ro-du-an-project-risk-management 

https://www.pmoadvisory.com/blog/everything-about-project-risk-management-and-pmi-rmp/

The correct answer is: Connectivity

Question text

A project manager needs stakeholder involvement in order to identify strategic and operational assumptions and constraints. Unfortunately, the project manager is having difficulty obtaining consistent input due to lack of participation.
